bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Telegram from Eleanor Lappage to Philip Showalter Hench, January 5, 1952

div1.p: Lappage informs Hench that there will be receptions on January 23 and January 24.

div1.head: Telegram from Eleanor Lappage to Philip Showalter Hench, January 5, 1952
div1.opener:
WESTERN
UNION
W. P. MARSHALL, PRESIDENT
CLASS OF SERVICE
----
This is a full-rate
Telegram or Cable-
gram unless its de-
ferred character is in-
dicated by a suitable
symbol above or pre-
ceding the address.
1201
__________________________________________________
The filing time shown in the date line on telegrams and day letters is STANDARD TIME at point of origin. Time of receipt in STANDARD TIME at point of destination
MA112 NSB101
NS.BMB089 NL PD=BIRMINGHAM ALA 5=
1952 JAN 5 PM 1 46
DR PHILLIP S HENCH- MAYO CLINIC=
ROCHESTER MINN=
div1.p:
DOCTOR SPIES ASKED ME TO TELL YOU THAT THE DEAN OF THE
MEDICAL SCHOOL UNIVERSITY OF HAVANA WILL GIVE A RECEIPTION
ON JANUARY 23RD 10 AM AND THE DIRECTORS OF FINLAY
INSTITUTE RECEPTION ON MORNING OF 24TH=
div1.closer: ELEANOR LAPPAGE SECTY=.. THE COMPANY WILL APPRECIATE SUGGESTIONS FROM ITS PATRONS CONCERNING ITS SERVICE
